name: cigarette
content:
cigarette

noun
 
 
/ˌsɪɡəˈret/
 
/ˈsɪɡəret/
jump to other results
  1. a thin tube of paper filled with tobacco, for smoking
    • to smoke/have a cigarette
    • a decrease in cigarette smoking
    • (British English) a packet of cigarettes
    • (especially North American English) a pack of cigarettes
    • to light a cigarette
    • the smell of cigarette smoke
    • There were three cigarette butts in the ashtray.
    • The man stubbed out his cigarette and lit a new one.
    see also e-cigarette, electronic cigarette
    Extra Examples
    • A cigarette dangled from his lips.
    • He accidentally dropped a lighted cigarette on the chair.
    • He drew on his cigarette and waited for the train.
    • He was sitting on the bench taking a cigarette break.
    • He'd bummed a cigarette from someone.
    • Please extinguish all cigarettes now.
    • Posters advertising cigarettes have to carry government health warnings.
    • She rolls her own cigarettes.
    • She slipped outside for an illicit cigarette.
    • She smokes a pack/​packet of cigarettes a day.
    • The cigarette burned slowly in the ashtray.
    • The cigarettes glowed in the dark.
    • The driver flicked his cigarette onto the roadside.
    • carelessly throwing a lighted cigarette in the litter bin
    • the smell of stale cigarette smoke
    Topics Social issuesa2
    Oxford Collocations Dictionaryadjective
    • lighted
    • lit
    • unlit
    • …
    … of cigarettes
    • pack
    • packet
    • carton
    • …
    verb + cigarette
    • smoke
    • draw on
    • pull on
    • …
    cigarette + verb
    • burn
    • glow
    • dangle
    • …
    cigarette + noun
    • ash
    • smoke
    • butt
    • …
    See full entry
    Word Originmid 19th cent.: from French, diminutive of cigare, probably from Mayan sik'ar ‘smoking’. Mayan is a language spoken in parts of Mexico and Central America.
See cigarette in the Oxford Advanced American DictionarySee cigarette in the Oxford Learner's Dictionary of Academic English

name: e-cigarette
content:
e-cigarette

noun
 
/ˈiː sɪɡəret/
 
/ˈiː sɪɡəret/
(also electronic cigarette)
jump to other results
  1. an electronic device, like a cigarette in shape, that contains nicotine that you can take into your lungs through your mouth, and that produces vapour that looks like cigarette smoke
Check pronunciation: e-cigarette

  1. the part of a cigarette that is left when somebody has finished smoking it

name: lighter
content:
lighter

noun
 
/ˈlaɪtə(r)/
 
/ˈlaɪtər/
jump to other results
  1. (also cigarette lighter)
     a small device that produces a flame for lighting cigarettes, etc.
    • He flicked his lighter but it didn’t catch.
    • She pulled out a small silver lighter from her bag.
    Oxford Collocations Dictionaryadjective
    • cigarette
    • butane
    • gas
    • …
    verb + lighter
    • flick
    • pull out
    See full entry
  2. a boat with a flat bottom used for carrying goods to and from ships in harbourTopics Transport by waterc2
    3. Word Originsense 2 late Middle English: from light (in the sense ‘unload’), or from Middle Low German luchter.
See lighter in the Oxford Advanced American Dictionary
